We will surely be looking forward to connect with you again. Thank you and you have a nice day ahead. You may now close the browser or click on Yes below if you would like to conitnue
Here is the kb for the VMware Snapshot Best Practices. https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/1025279. Was it helpful ?

For the error occurred in your environment, please ensure the datastore on which the VM is deployed is having enough free space. Watch out for space related alarms at VM/Host and Datastore Level. For more info, please refer the VMware KB https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/51613. Was this helpful ?
Here is the article to understand the FAQ for snapshot removal/deletion https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/1023657. Was this helpful ?

The consolidation/Removal task hanging at 95% or 99% is in most cases related to 1.  Size of the virtual machine. Larger the size of the disk more time it will take to remove. 2. At the same time, please check for any storage latency issues to confirm storage performance https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2001003 . Was this helpful ?

This issue occurs if a virtual disk file or its snapshot disk is not present at the path specified in the Verify the path and structure of the VM files using the kb https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/1003757 Traverse through the history of the virtual machine log files to understand what exactly transpired on the VM disks. Was this helpful ?

For the error occurred in your environment, please ensure there are no RDM/sharing disks attached and the mode of the scsi controller are set to normal. For more info, please refer the VMware KB https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/80246. Was this helpful ?

For the error occurred in your environment, please ensure there are no hung/failed/frozen backup issues or migration tasks for that specific VM. You can further use vmfsfilelockinfo -p command on that disk to determine the host that is locking the file. For more info, please refer the VMware KB https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/1038189. Was this helpful ?

For the error occurred in your environment, please ensure the parent and child disk consistency is intact using the command vmfkstools -D or vmkfstools -q.  For more info, please refer the VMware KB https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/1007969. Was this helpful ?

This issue occurs if ESXi host has a problem accessing the underlying storage devices or data stores. Troubleshoot and resolve any issues with the underlying storage devices and connect with your storage vendor to further troubleshoot this For more info, please refer to the kb https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/1003680. Was this helpful ?
Here is the article to understand the whole concept of Snapshot. http://www.vmwarearena.com/deep-dive-the-ultimate-guide-to-master-vmware-snapshot/
For the error occurred in your environment, please ensure the default plugin is NMP. You may refer to the vmware kb https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/83249 for further info. Did this resolution help ?

For this error, please ensure the datastore is not a part of any of the replication lun and the datastore uuid is different/unique. You may refer to the vmware kb https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/1011387 for further info. Did this resolution help ?

For this error, please ensure the host has accessibility to the NFS server and all required ports are open. is not a part of any of the replication lun and the datastore uuid is different/unique. You may refer to the vmware kb https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/1005948 for further info. Did this resolution help ?
Here is the kb for the VMware Snapshot Best Practices. https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/1025279. Was it helpful ?
Here is the kb for the VMware Snapshot Best Practices. https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/1025279. Was it helpful ?
Here is the article to understand the whole concept of Snapshot. http://www.vmwarearena.com/deep-dive-the-ultimate-guide-to-master-vmware-snapshot/
Here is the article to understand the whole concept of Snapshot. http://www.vmwarearena.com/deep-dive-the-ultimate-guide-to-master-vmware-snapshot/

Please ensure the there are no VMs or templates inside the datastore before unmounting it. You may refer to the vmware kb https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/1015791 for further info. Did this resolution help ?

Please ensure the there the Datastore is not a part of the HA heartbeat datastore cluster. You may refer to the vmware blog https://www.yellow-bricks.com/2013/02/25/how-to-disable-datastore-heartbeating/ for further info. Did this resolution help ?
Please ensure the there the NFS Datastore does not have SIOC enabled on it. You may refer to the vmware kb https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2008507 for further info. Did this resolution help ?
